APEGA Membership as a P.Eng. or EIT.

In depth knowledge of logic programming and hardware design of multiple site DCS & PLC systems (e.g., DeltaV, ABB Advant, 800xA & Symphony and Modicon PLC).
3+ years’ experience in process industries related to process control.
Ability to troubleshoot process control systems and provide recommendations for either logic improvement or field repairs.

Experience / knowledge with alarm management, advanced process control, real time optimization, artificial intelligent / machine learning, Aveva Historian, computer virtualization and TCP/IP networking is an asset.

The Department of Medical Physics at Princess Margaret Cancer Centre (University Health Network) is seeking an experienced imaging researcher to work as a member of their Functional Imaging Biomarker Development team. Background:
Germline carriers of mutations in genes associated with familial cancer syndromes (FCS) and family members have increased cancer mortality, and all carriers within a family undergo intensive cancer surveillance, primarily with diagnostic imaging. In this project, the researcher will be responsible to process the imaging data and collaborate with genomics experts to jointly analyze the imaging and ctDNA genomic information. In the first phase of the project, simple pipelines – PyRadiomics and ElasticNet for instance – will be first implemented to investigate data quality and set the baseline for more complex pipelines. In the second phase, deep learning techniques – convolutional neural networks for instance - will be developed to generate new imaging features and combine them with genomic and demographic data.
